title: Problem with pip installation on Ubuntu
body_html:
I referred to the Pytorch Documentation to install it. To install it though pip with usage of Python 3.6 following command is given, but it doesn't work
$ pip install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl pip install torchvision
Output for the following command is:

torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.

But I managed to install pytorch through
$sudo pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
For torchvision:
$ sudo pip3 install torchvision
Installation requires usage of root privileges and pip3. Referred instructions should be changed on getting started section of doucmentation .

body:
I referred to the Pytorch Documentation to install it. To install it though pip with usage of Python 3.6 following command is given, but it doesn't work
``
$ pip install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl 
pip install torchvision
``
Output for the following command is:
>torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.

But I managed to install pytorch through 
``
$sudo pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl 
``
For torchvision:
``
$ sudo pip3 install torchvision
``
Installation requires usage of root privileges and pip3. Referred instructions should be changed on getting started section of [doucmentation](http://pytorch.org/) .
